prompt:
Give an example of a well-known phrase or idiom from your country that you think should be more widely known in other countries. What does it mean, and why is it important?
My country is the United States and I believe that the phrase "When in Rome, do as the Romans" should be better known among other nations. This expression means that when one visits or resides in another place, especially a foreign city, one ought to conform to the local ways of doing things. It emphasizes the importance of adapting to and respecting different cultures and customs around the world.
